name: 許哲奇
objective: This course surveys the principal concepts of fluid dynamics. Topics include mass and momentum conservation, the Navier-Stokes equation for viscous flows, as well as dimensional analysis. Emphasis is placed on being able to utilize the concepts to solve the real problems encountered during conducting research
schedule:
Course Syllabus
1-2 weeks: Introduction to Momentum Transport
3-4 weeks: Shell Momentum Balance
5-8 weeks: Vectors and Tensors 
9-10 weeks: Reynold’s transport theorem and the kinematics of fluid motion
11-12 weeks: Stress in fluids
13 week: Viscosity and the Momentum transport 
14 week: Equation of Motion: Navier-Stokes Equation
15-16 weeks: Case study
17 week: Final Exam
18 week: Discussion
scorePolicy:
Grading Plan：
Homework and Quizzes 30%
Presentation 30%
Final Exam 40%
materials:
R. Aris, Vectors, Tensors, and the Basic Equations of Fluid Mechanics 
R. B. Bird, W. E. Stewart and E. N. Lightfoot, Transport Phenomena 2nd edition
